trans-unit.source: When the sample game starts play, the game object can be in one of three states:
trans-unit.target: When the sample game starts play, the game object can be in one of three states:

trans-unit.source: **Waiting for resources**.
trans-unit.target: **Waiting for resources**.

trans-unit.source: This state is activated when the game object is initialized or when the components of a level are being loaded.
trans-unit.target: This state is activated when the game object is initialized or when the components of a level are being loaded.

trans-unit.source: If this state was triggered by a request to load a prior game, the game stats overlay is displayed; if it was triggered by a request to play a level, the level start overlay is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If this state was triggered by a request to load a prior game, the game stats overlay is displayed; if it was triggered by a request to play a level, the level start overlay is displayed.

trans-unit.source: The completion of resource loading causes the game to pass through the **Resources loaded** state and then transition into the **Waiting for press** state.
trans-unit.target: The completion of resource loading causes the game to pass through the **Resources loaded** state and then transition into the **Waiting for press** state.

trans-unit.source: **Waiting for press**.
trans-unit.target: **Waiting for press**.

trans-unit.source: This state is activated when the game is paused, either by the player or by the system (after, say, loading resources).
trans-unit.target: This state is activated when the game is paused, either by the player or by the system (after, say, loading resources).

trans-unit.source: When the player is ready to exit this state, the player is prompted to load a new game state (LoadGame), start or restart the loaded level (StartLevel), or continue the current level (ContinueGame).
trans-unit.target: When the player is ready to exit this state, the player is prompted to load a new game state (LoadGame), start or restart the loaded level (StartLevel), or continue the current level (ContinueGame).

trans-unit.source: **Dynamics**.
trans-unit.target: **Dynamics**.

trans-unit.source: If a player's press input is completed and the resulting action is to start or continue a level, the game object transitions into the *Dynamics* state.
trans-unit.target: If a player's press input is completed and the resulting action is to start or continue a level, the game object transitions into the *Dynamics* state.

trans-unit.source: The game is played in this state, and the game world and player objects are updated here based on animation routines and player input.
trans-unit.target: The game is played in this state, and the game world and player objects are updated here based on animation routines and player input.

trans-unit.source: This state is left when the player triggers a pause event, either by pressing P, by taking an action that deactivates the main window, or by completing a level or the game.
